intro: Sisyrinchium lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf blue-eyed grass, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of sky-blue flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky soils. It is part of the Iridaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. Sisyrinchium lanceolatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
